string.text: The .45 caliber full metal jacket round has enjoyed popularity for more than a hundred years thanks to its heavy bullet and a relatively small propelling charge. As a result, the bullet in this round is relatively slow but highly accurate and provides considerable stopping power.
The 7.62x51mm NATO (official NATO nomenclature 7.62 NATO) is a rifle cartridge developed in the 1950s as a standard for small arms among NATO countries.

This unusual .45 ACP caliber round is comprised of a jacketed soft point bullet with an expanding hollow and a steel core. It is a combination of jacketed expanding soft point and armor piercing bullets, benefiting, from the advantages of both and, suffering from their downsides.
The 7.62x51mm NATO AP - Armour piersing ammunition for large caliber rifles.
Standard 12-caliber round filled with 6 mm shot. Highly lethal at close range. Only suitable for use with smoothbore weapons.
This heavy 12 caliber slug round is normally used for hunting big game, but is also good for other purposes. Instead of piercing, this hefty slug simply crushes through armor.
Military 5.45x39 7H22 caliber armor-piercing round for automatic rifles of Warsaw Pact countries. The bullet contains a hard-alloy armor piercing penetrator. Effective against body armor.

Military 5.45x39 7H10 caliber improved piercing round for automatic rifles of Warsaw Pact countries. Provides better accuracy than the 7.62 caliber round thanks to reduced recoil and a 100 meter increase in range.
A common NATO military 5.56x45 caliber armor piercing round, known under its SS190/M855 index, widely used by Western security agencies and special services. Effective against body armor.

A standard issue NATO 5.56x45 caliber round specially designed for accurate automatic fire. Provides good ballistic characteristics, having been designed on the basis of a hunting round. Widely known under its SS109 index.
A 7.62 caliber sniper round with a steel penetrator specially designed for the SVD. Unlike the machine gun round, the 7H1 provides tight groupings and excellent penetration characteristics.
Cheap 7.62 caliber machine gun round. Its design makes it unsuitable for sniper rifles, so it is used only with the PKM machine gun.
A full metal jacket round with a steel penetrator and a lead core under a metal jacket. Provides good stopping power but is ineffective against body armor.

This round contains a bullet with enhanced stopping power, while its European +P+ designation indicates "overpressure ammunition" with a 30% increase in muzzle velocity. Ineffective against body armor.

This basic 9x19 caliber round with a jacketed bullet has good characteristics while being simple to produce. The round is popular due to the fact that international conventions prohibit the use of expanding ammunition in combat. Ineffective against body armor.

This 9x19 caliber jacketed hollow point bullet with an expanding hollow provides high stopping power and low ricochet propensity. Used by police and for self-defense. Ineffective against body armor due to its low penetration potential.

The SP-6 is a subsonic assault rifle round with a jacketed soft point bullet with a hard steel core that protrudes from the casing. Requires a silencer for stealth firing. Used by special services of Warsaw Pact countries. Effective against body armor.

The SP-5 is a subsonic sniper round with a bimetallic casing. The round contains a steel core with a gap behind it that is filled with lead. Requires a silencer for stealth firing. Used by special services of Warsaw Pact countries.
40 mm grenade for the M203 underbarrel grenade launcher. This round has a 5 meter kill zone. Also suitable for use in the FN F2000 integrated grenade launcher.

Fragmentation warhead for anti-personnel warfare used with the RPG-7 grenade launcher. The main purpose of the warhead is to kill enemies in cover outside the range of hand grenades using the RPG-7 launcher.

Regular fragmentation grenade for the GP-25 Kastyor underbarrel grenade launcher. This round has a 5 meter kill zone. The VOG-25 grenade is also used in the OC-14 Groza complex and RG6 / 6G30 revolver-type grenade launcher.

The 7.62x51mm NATO (official NATO nomenclature 7.62 NATO) is a rifle cartridge developed in the 1950s as a standard for small arms among NATO countries. Ammunition for HK-417 Sniper, SR-25 and TRG-42.
The 7.62x51mm NATO AP - Armour piersing ammunition for HK-417 Sniper, SAKO TRG-42 and SR-25.

The 7.62x39 mm rifle cartridge was designed during World War II and first used in the SKS carbine by the Soviet Union. Use of the cartridge is widespread by both militaries and civilians. This is due primarily to the proliferation of the SKS and AK-47 pattern rifles during the 20th century..

The 7.62x39 mm rifle cartridge was designed during World War II and first used in the SKS carbine by the Soviet Union. Use of the cartridge is widespread by both militaries and civilians. This is due primarily to the proliferation of the SKS and AK-47 pattern rifles during the 20th century..
Detachable optical scope made specifically for NATO rifles.
Detachable optical scope with night vision for NATO rifles.
Detachable optical scope with adjustable magnification for NATO rifles.
Detachable optical scope with thermal imaging capability for NATO rifles.
A common Soviet-made 5.0x fixed zoom optical scope with a range scale. Attached to weapons by means of a dovetail mount, which is standard in Warsaw Pact countries.

A 5.0x fixed zoom optical scope with a built-in heat visor used to identify heat sources typical of the human body. Designed for use by special forces. Attached to weapons by means of a dovetail mount.
An image intensifier night vision 5.0x fixed zoom scope for combat in darkness. Attached to weapons by means of a dovetail mount.
An adjustable long-range 1.6-4x zoom scope that can use automatic adjustment to provide greater fire effectiveness. Attached to weapons by means of the NATO-standard Picatinny rail.
A 4x fixed zoom scope produced primarily in Western countries. Attached to weapons by means of the NATO-standard Picatinny rail. Often used for accurate fire from small arms at medium to long range.
An optical SUSAT 1.6x higher contrast scope for combat in reduced lighting conditions. Attached to weapons by means of the NATO-standard Picatinny rail.
A 4.0x fixed zoom scope with a night vision device for long range combat in darkness. Attached to weapons by means of the NATO-standard Picatinny rail.
An optical SUSAT 1.6x scope for combat at short to medium range. Attached to weapons by means of the NATO-standard Picatinny rail.
A 2.7x optical scope for urban combat at medium range. Attached to weapons by means of a dovetail mount.
An old and worn optic scope with 4x zoom used for specific weapon models of World War 2.
An old and worn optic scope with 4x zoom used for specific weapon models of World War 2.
Special designed telescopic sight for the VSK-94 silenced firearm.

An effective sound suppressor for caliber 5.56x45 weapons. The body of the silencer around the barrel contains a roll of fine brass mesh, while the front comprises a set of metal with holes for the bullet to pass through. Normally used to thin out enemy ranks without drawing attention.

An effective sound suppressor for caliber 9x18 weapons. The body of the silencer around the barrel contains a roll of fine brass mesh, while the front comprises a set of metal with holes for the bullet to pass through. Normally used to thin out enemy ranks without drawing attention.

An effective sound suppressor for caliber 9x19 weapons. The body of the silencer around the barrel contains a roll of fine brass mesh, while the front comprises a set of metal with holes for the bullet to pass through. Normally used to thin out enemy ranks without drawing attention.

An effective sound suppressor for caliber 9x39 weapons. The body of the silencer around the barrel contains a roll of fine brass mesh, while the front comprises a set of metal with holes for the bullet to pass through. Normally used to thin out enemy ranks without drawing attention.

An effective sound suppressor for caliber 5.45x39 weapons. The body of the silencer around the barrel contains a roll of fine brass mesh, while the front comprises a set of metal with holes for the bullet to pass through. Normally used to thin out enemy ranks without drawing attention.

An effective sound suppressor for caliber 5.56x45 weapons. The body of the silencer around the barrel contains a roll of fine brass mesh, while the front comprises a set of metal with holes for the bullet to pass through. Normally used to thin out enemy ranks without drawing attention.

An effective sound suppressor for caliber 7.62x39 weapons. The body of the silencer around the barrel contains a roll of fine brass mesh, while the front comprises a set of metal with holes for the bullet to pass through. Normally used to thin out enemy ranks without drawing attention.

An effective sound suppressor for caliber 7.62x51 weapons. The body of the silencer around the barrel contains a roll of fine brass mesh, while the front comprises a set of metal with holes for the bullet to pass through. Normally used to thin out enemy ranks without drawing attention.

An effective sound suppressor for caliber 7.62x54 weapons. The body of the silencer around the barrel contains a roll of fine brass mesh, while the front comprises a set of metal with holes for the bullet to pass through. Normally used to thin out enemy ranks without drawing attention.

An effective sound suppressor for caliber 1143x23 weapons. The body of the silencer around the barrel contains a roll of fine brass mesh, while the front comprises a set of metal with holes for the bullet to pass through. Normally used to thin out enemy ranks without drawing attention.

A defensive hand grenade, with fragments capable of piercing medium level body armor. The grenade has a 7 meter kill radius. Stalkers get F1 grenades from trading with the military, who write them off as having been used for fighting mutants.

A single shot, front loaded, rifled underbarrel grenade launcher for assault rifles made in Warsaw Pact countries. The firing mechanism is self-cocking, with a manual safety catch and automatic shot prevention if incorrectly installed onto a rifle. Uses VOG-25 grenades.

A modified M203 grenade launcher that has been shortened by three inches, attached to weapons by means of a Picatinny Rail. Thanks to a changed mount, this grenade launcher is widely used around the world.
An offensive hand grenade with a small kill zone of 5 meters. Often used by stalkers to "smoke out" mutants due to its relatively low cost.

A incendiary grenade (or thermite grenade), that produce a intense heat by means of a chemical reaction. The filler is 600 to 800 grams of thermate, the chemical reaction that produces the heat is called a thermite reaction. In this reaction, powdered aluminium metal and iron oxide react to produce a stream of molten iron and aluminium oxide. This reaction produces a tremendous amount of heat, burning at 2,200 °C (3,992 °F).
A hand smoke grenade. Used to put up smoke screens. Once the grenade is thrown it takes 10 seconds for the smoke screen to expand.

A more accurate and reliable rifle than the AKM, the AK-74 is still used by the majority of countries of the former USSR. The AKS-74 is equipped with a side-folding metal shoulder stock and is designed primarily for use with air assault infantry.This particular variant of the AK-74 is using the ERDL pattern, aka the "leaf pattern". In 1948, the US Army Engineer Research and Development Laboratory (ERDL) designed a general purpose jungle camouflage consisting of mid-brown and grass green organic shapes with black "branches" on a lime green background. This camouflage has been used militarily by many countries and remains popular around the world.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Grenadelauncher
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 5.45x39

The AKS-74U was intended as a personal defense weapon for tank, gun, helicopter and other vehicle crews, and for the special operations forces, which required compact but relatively powerful individual automatic weapon. This particular model of the AKS-74U is using the Bulgarian four colour urban disruptive pattern. Used by Bulgarian Air Force and Gendarmerie serving in ISAF (Afghanistan). In use since 2004.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 5.45x39

The 92F is perhaps best known as the standard pistol of the US Military, replacing the legendary M1911. It is a short-recoil operated, locked-breech weapon with an aluminum frame and a hard chromed barrel bore. A popular sidearm adopted by several countries.This particular model is using the US MARPAT desert camouflage. MARPAT patterns are produced by highly complex fractal equations that result in a non-repeating pattern. The purpose of the digitized pattern is to match the visual texture of typical backgrounds. When used in an operative environment, its textured appearance and lack of hard edges make it more effective than traditional patterns.
Basic utility knife, preferred by stalkers in the zone as universal tool. Limited combat usability.

Needing a cheap, short range weapon that's effective and lethal, many rookie Stalkers resort to sawing off the buttstock and barrel on the easily acquired TOZ 66. This makes the shotgun quick to wield, but at the cost of range and accuracy.

This is the type of shotgun bought by the novice Stalker "Irish Rampage". Owl keeps telling the story about the trade where Irish shouted "Oh God, I fucking HATE short rifles, yet here I am FORCED to buy this fucking model! And I can't figure out why!" He ran to Beards bar and started screaming that "EVERYONE in this room is to blame for the STUPID design of this rifle!" Then he took aim as if he wanted to start a killing spree, only to blow his own head right off as he had turned the shotgun the wrong way out of utter disorientation... The Zone really does terrible things to the minds of good people.

A powerful weapon that every stalker can afford, the TOZ 66 is a close range weapon that proves itself both reliable and effective. However, being large and unwieldy, many stalkers prefer to spend their hard earned rubles on a modern handgun instead.

The M1911 became the standard issue side arm for the U.S. military from 1911 to 1985. An extremely reliable and robust weapon, it’s been adopted for military, police and civilian use around the world and remains a very popular firearm to this day.This particular model is using a South Vietnamese camouflage based on the US m1948 ERDL camouflage pattern. This ARVN "leaf" or "Airborne leaf" pattern was a fairly accurate copy of the US ERDL design, having the same mid-brown, russet, & biege organic shapes with dark brown "branches".

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 11.43x23

A hand-made pistol based on the Desert Eagle design. The components are finely tuned to achieve incredible accuracy for a handgun of this type.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 11.43x23

Designed by Magnum Research, US, the Desert Eagle uses a gas-operated mechanism normally found in rifles. This allows the pistol to use far more powerful rounds than traditional semi-automatic pistol designs. The drawback to this weapon is it’s size and weight.This particular model is a custom desert eagle, it is using a variant of the tiger stripe camouflage pattern of the Philippine Navy Special Warfare Group, which has been issued since 1990. However, many tiger stripe patterns have been used since the vietnam era where it originated.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 11.43x23

The FS2000 Tactical is a civilian legal, semi-auto only variant of the F2000 selective-fire bullpup carbine. that offers an integrated MIL-STD 1913 top mounting rail and emergency backup folding sights. Fitted with a permament EOTech holograhic sight.The FN F2000 is used by the Slovenian Army, this particular model uses the M91 Oakleaf Pattern. The Slovenian M91 oakleaf pattern has been in service since 1991. The pattern is based on the Yugoslavian M87 small oak leaf pattern, but uses different colours.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scope (permanent)
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 5.56x45

The first pistol developed by the independent Ukraine (one of the former USSR republics), the Fort-12 is a blowback operated, double action pistol. The ergonomics, accuracy and magazine capacity of the Fort 12 are an improvement over the older Makarov PM.The earliest camouflage patterns produced by an independent Ukraine were variants of the Soviet-designed 1988 TTsKO (Trisvetnaia kamuflirovannaia odezhda). As with those produced during the Soviet period (and by Russia thereafter), Ukrainian factories have turned out several versions of the pattern incorporating varied color schemes. Unlike virtually every other former Soviet republic, Ukraine continues to wear versions of this pattern, which is the standard camouflage design of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. The pattern is known as dubok (little oak) in Ukraine.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 9x18

Developed in 1994, the G2 aligns the French Famas rifle closer to NATO standards by using the STANAG magazine and having tighter rifling than the older F1 model. The G2 also has one of the highest cyclic fire rates of any weapon in the Zone.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scopes
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 5.56x45
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Grenadelauncher m203

Formally accepted into service with the IDF in 1972, the IMI Galil is designed for operation in arid conditions and is based on the Finnish RK 62, which itself was derived from the Soviet AK-47. The Galil has a line chambered for 5.56x45mm and one for 7.62x51mm.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scopes
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 7.62x51

The Sturmgewehr 44 is considered by many historians to be the first modern assault rifle. It’s concept had a major impact on modern infantry small arms development. In the Zone this rifle is a popular primary weapon among novice and semi experienced Stalkers within all factions.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scopes
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 5.45x39

The M16A1 is essentially the same weapon as the M16 with a forward assist. Although replaced in the United States by newer members of the M16 family, the M16A1 is still standard issue in many world armies. This particular weapon has a fixed telescopic sight.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]M16 Scope (permanent)
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 5.56x45

The SG 552 Commando is designed for urban combat, making it the most compact member of SIG’s renowned SG 550 family. Enhancing it’s CQC capabilities, this SG 552 Commando comes equipped with an EOTech holographic sight.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Dot sight (permanent)
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 5.56x45
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Grenadelauncher m203

A sniper rifle of the US Army, the M24 Sniper Weapon System (SWS) is based on the Remington 700. Fitted with a Leupold 10x40mm scope, the M24 has a stainless steel barrel and an adjustable composite stock made from Kevlar and graphite.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]M24 Sniper scope (permanent)

A sniper rifle of the US Army, the M24 Sniper Weapon System (SWS) is based on the Remington 700. Fitted with a Leupold 10x40mm scope, the M24 has a stainless steel barrel and an adjustable composite stock made from Kevlar and graphite.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scopes

"Obrez" is a Russian word meaning "cut". This "Obrez" is a sawn-off Mosin-Nagant M91/30. Mainly used by rebels and criminals, it still fires the original rifle cartridge. It's "classified" as a hybrid between a bolt-action pistol and a shotgun, ie: a budget hand-cannon!

Based on previous AK rifles in internal design and layout, the AEK-971 is also equipped with a recoil-balancing mechanism, resulting in more controllable automatic fire. Small batches of this rifle were manufactured for the Russian MVD.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scopes
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 7.62x39
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Grenadelauncher

The AKS-74 Kobra is a camouflaged variation of the AKS-74. It is equipped with a Kobra optical collimator sight. This "reflex" sight has no magnification, allowing for rapid target aquisition and engagement with one, or both eyes open.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Dot sight (permanent)
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 5.45x39
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Grenadelauncher

Assault rifle chambered with the heavy 7.62x51mm round and with custom Magpul stock. Expensive rifle designed for medium to long distance precision shooting with permanent scope and special magazine.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scope (permanent)
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 7.62x51
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Grenadelauncher m203

The FAL is one of the most produced and widely used firearms in the world. Used by many NATO countries during the Cold War, it was nicknamed “The right arm of the Free World”. This Zone version has a custom grip and Magpul stock and a FN CAL handguard.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,144,50,26]• %c[default]Scopes
%c[255,144,50,26]• %c[default]Grenadelauncher m203
%c[255,144,50,26]• %c[default]Silencer 7.62x51

The FS2000 Tactical is a civilian legal, semi-auto only variant of the F2000 selective-fire bullpup carbine. that offers an integrated MIL-STD 1913 top mounting rail and emergency backup folding sights. Fitted with a permament EOTech holograhic sight.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scope (permanent)
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 5.56x45

The DMR fills the need for a lightweight, accurate weapon system utilizing the 7.62x51mm NATO round. Marine Corps Explosive Ordnance Disposal Teams, Scout Snipers and sniper spotters also used DMRs when the mission requires rapid, accurate fire at long range.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scope (permanent)
Unknown sniper rifle with the sign "Muzgaran" on the muzzle.

The Kalashnikov RPK-74 light machine gun has been developed during mid-seventies to complement the AK-74 assault rifle a sa standard squad automatic weapon of the Soviet army. It is based on the parent AK-74 assault rifle but with extended magazine.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 5.45x39
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scopes

The XM8 was a reconfigurable weapon system that underwent trials in the US to become the replacement for the M16 rifle and the M4 carbine. It includes an integrated optical sight and IR laser aiming module. The program was cancelled in 2005.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scope (permanent)
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 5.56x45

The VSK-94 silenced rifle was developed by the KBP (Instrument DesignBureau) as an attempt to create a less expensive variant of the special purpose VSS “Vintorez” 9mm silenced military rifle.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scopes
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer (permanent)

The SKS-45 is one of the first weapons chambered for the 7.62x39mm round. Replaced in Soviet front-line service by the AK-47 in the early 1950s, it remained in second-line service for decades and is still used as a ceremonial arm today.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 7.62x39
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scopes

The Mossberg 500 short is a Mossberg 500 with a smaller barrel for less weight and improved maneuverability though sacrifices the already short range of the Mossberg 500. Intended for use in harsh and dirty conditions, the Mossberg 500 is designed to be easily maintained and cleaned. Although this Zone modified 500 is ideal for quick reaction firing, it has drastically decreased accuracy and ammo capacity.

Ideal for CQC (Close Quarters Combat), the M4A1 carbine is a fully automatic variant of the M16A2 assault rifle. In military use, it has largely replaced the submachine gun which fires pistol-power cartridges that are inadequate against modern body armor.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 5.56x45
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scopes
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Grenadelauncher m203

Adopting a simple gas-operated mechanism from Soviet SVT rifles, Nazi Germany developed the Gewehr 43 semi-automatic rifle. It was renamed Karabiner 43 in 1944. Equipped with the ZF 4 telescopic sight, it is an effective sniper rifle.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]G-43 sniper scope (permanent)

The GP100 is a second generation Ruger double-action revolver made stronger with the intent to fire an unlimited number of full-power .357 Magnum rounds. It’s changed frame shape makes it one of the most durable and comfortable shooting revolvers.

The FAR-15 is a customized AR-15 made by Fulton Armory with a collapsible stock, more high quality parts, and a slightly farther range. This personalized model has camouflage texturing, dotsight and a permanent silencer attachment.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Dot sight (permanent)
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer (permanent)
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Grenadelauncher m203

Originally chambered for the .32 ACP when adopted by the Czechoslovak Army in 1961, full production of the 9x19mm Skorpion vz. 68 never occurred. Even so, a large number of pre-production vz. 68 models made their way into the Zone.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 9x19

A major infantry weapon of the Soviet armed forces during World War II, the PPSh-41 was a durable, low-maintenance weapon made of cheap, easily-obtained components. These Zone modified versions fire the readily available 9x18mm Makarov round.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 9x18

Providing greater stopping power than the MP5, the UMP45 also produces more recoil. This makes controlling full automatic fire more difficult. The UMP45’s cyclic rate of fire was lowered significantly to combat this problem.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 11.43x23

Simultaneously adopted into Soviet service in 1951 with the Makarov PM, the Stechkin APS is a Russian selective fire machine pistol. Originally intended as a sidearm for artillery, armor and aircraft personnel, it is now phased out of active service.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 9x18

The GSh-18 was developed in the ‘90s in Tula to be capable of punching through all known bullet-proof vests with standard bullets. With the 7N21 and 7N31 armor-piercing bullets, it can punch through 8mm of steel at 20 meters.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 9x19

The AKM (literally translated “Kalashnikov modernized automatic rifle”) is an upgraded version of the AK-47 rifle. Although it was replaced in Soviet Front-Line service by the AK-74 in the 1970s, the AKM is the most widely used variant of the AK series of firearms.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 7.62x39
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scopes
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Grenadelauncher

A highly reliable semi-automatic combat shotgun, the Saiga-12K is based on the legendary AK-47 assault rifle design. Earning respect in the Zone for it's lethality, it is intended for engaging targets at short range (50 meters or less) or in enclosed areas.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scopes
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 12x70

An iconic Soviet firearm, the TT-33 is an improved version of the TT-30, a semi-automatic pistol developed in 1930 to replace the aging Nagant M1895 revolver. Even though TT-33 production in Russia ran from 1933 to 1954, copies are still in service and produced today.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 9x19

The OTs-33 is a blowback-operated weapon firing the 9x18mm Makarov pistol cartridge in automatic and semi-automatic mode. The Pernach (Russian for “multivaned mace”) was developed in 1995 to replace the Stechkin APS pistol in special paramilitary units.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 9x18

The AK-105 is a shortened carbine version of the AK-74M (AK-74 modernized) rifle. The AK-105 is supplementing AKS-74U carbines in Russian Army service. Ideal for CQC (close quarters combat), it’s not intended for long range combat.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 5.45x39
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Grenadelauncher

During World War II, certain Karabiner 98k rifles were selected for their exceptional accuracy and fitted with the ZF39 telescopic sight. These rifles were used by Nazi Germany as sniper rifles. In skilled hands, they had an effective range of up to 1000 meters.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scopes
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 7.62x54

Adopted for Spetsnaz forces and specialist front-line combat units, the OTs-14-4A allows for assembly of one of four weapon versions, depending on the mission. This zone version is assembled with the GP-25 grenade launcher.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 9x39
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Grenadelauncher (permanent)

Being the only variant of the OTs-14-4A, the OTs-14-1A “Groza-1” is chambered for 7.62x39mm. Fire rate, flatness and magazine capacity are improved using this lighter, faster round. The Groza-1 was only produced in small batches.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scopes
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 7.62x39
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Grenadelauncher (permanent)

A modified model of a pistol from the first half of the 20th century, which is as reliable, powerful and accurate as the original. Pistols of this series deserve their reputation as one of the best handguns of the 20th century and are in great demand in the Zone.An interesting camouflage design emerged in the 1970s for test by Polish special purpose troops. Known as the Gepard (leopard) design, this pattern incorporated black & reddish brown leopard spots on a field grey background. It is believed only the special purpose uniform was produced in this pattern, and probably only for testing as the uniform does not appear to have been adopted. A similar design, however, emerged in use with special units of the Zaire Armed Forces in the late 1970s, with a variant also appearing in Chad.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 9x19

A modified model of a pistol from the first half of the 20th century, which is as reliable, powerful and accurate as the original. Pistols of this series deserve their reputation as one of the best handguns of the 20th century and are in great demand in the Zone.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 9x19

The standard individual weapon for the British armed forces, the L85 (in it’s original A1 version) had numerous performance issues. The improved L85A2 is extremely reliable over a range of climates for various operational scenarios.In 1966 the British Ministry of Defense issued the Pattern 1960 DPM (P60), the first in a long line of Disruptive Pattern Material uniforms to be issued by the British Armed Forces. The cut of the standard uniform was based on the Pattern 60 olive green combat uniform, but made in the DPM material. 

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]l85 scope (permanent)
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Grenadelauncher m203

The MP5’s compactness, accuracy and reliability have made it a favorite of numerous military, law enforcement, Intelligence and security organizations the world over. The MP5A3 is fitted with a retractable metal stock. This submachine gun has gained popularity around the world thanks to its reliability, ease of use and accuracy. Not surprisingly, having flooded the global black markets, it eventually made its way to the Zone.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 9x19

A submachine gun prototype based on the excellent H&K MP5A3 model. Designed as a next generation close quarter combat weapon, it benefits from a higher caliber, rate of fire and accuracy.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 9x19

This weapon was previously owned by Zulu. Its special features include an enlarged ammo box and a particularly reliable retracting mechanism design. The modifications meant an increase in the weapon's weight, but that wasn't a problem for the last owner.

An ancient Makarov PM received by Degtyarev as a reward for "Successful execution of highly dangerous state orders, as well as valor and courage shown in the line of duty."

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 9x18

The uniquely designed Armsel Protecta is a rotating cylinder fed 12-gauge shotgun developed for riot control and combat. Antiquated now by the Russian Saiga-12 and the American AA-12, the Protecta was a revolutionary weapon in the 1980’s.A smoothbore combat revolver-type shotgun intended to provide extreme firepower for militarized units. The weapon benefits from a large magazine and a high effective rate of fire, but its bulkiness and considerable weight, combined with a long reload time, are the price to be paid for these advantages. Rare in the Zone and is used primarily to clear closed spaces of mutants. This particular model of the Armsel Protecta is using the widely used m81 woodland camouflage. The m81 woodland pattern has been one of the most duplicated and modified camouflage patterns ever designed, seeing service with military forces around the world and continuing to be worn today.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scopes

The RG-6 was required to increase the firepower of the infantry during urban combat, seen in small-scale conflicts, such as the Chechen wars.This revolver-type grenade launcher uses six rifled front-loading barrels, identical to underbarrel launcher attachments. The drum is also front-loading. Widely used for rapid suppression of enemy firing positions and, when in the open, attacking defended fixed targets or fighting particularly tough monsters.

Fitted with a skeleton buttstock made from wood and fitted with a hinged buttplate, and a wooden pistol grip. The rear part of the buttstock houses an cleaning kit, and a disassembled cleaning rod is stored in the right leg of the bipod. A very reliable machine gun.

A unique model of the SIG-Sauer P220 handgun. Part of a small limited edition made for an unidentified special forces unit. The model benefits from an increased magazine capacity, a high durability steel barrel and an ultradurable polymer receiver.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 11.43x23

Renowned for its high production quality and good performance, the SG 550 is often referred to as the finest 5.56 mm rifle ever made. It has a side-folding skeletonized buttstock and a lightweight aluminum bipod that folds into grooves in the lower handguard.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scopes
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 5.56x45
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Grenadelauncher m203

A Swiss-made SIG SG550 assault rifle. Although it is hardly new, it is clear that the previous owner took good care of it: the weapon has been taken apart and put back together, with every component fine-tuned for optimum performance, increasing stopping power. The letter "S" has been carved into the stock, "this must be Strelok's customized SIG".

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scopes
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 5.56x45
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Grenadelauncher m203

The SPSA-AUT self-cocking shotgun is made only in Duty workshops. This weapon is intended for fighting large groups of mutants. Its improved feeding mechanism ensures a high rate of fire and the magazine capacity has been increased to 10 rounds. Uses 12x70 caliber rounds.

An army shotgun designed specifically for assault units on the basis of the Franchi SPAS-12. Capable of automatic fire like its predecessor, but provides better recoil compensation thanks to a balanced shock free system.

Originally intended for designated marksmen in every basic Soviet infantry unit, the Dragunov SVD was not designed for specialized sniper teams. Relatively light for a sniper rifle but well balanced and having semiautomatic fire, its precision is good but not exceptional.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]SVD scope (permanent)

A hand-assembled version of the SVDm-2 sniper rifle with enforced mechanisms for increased flatness. Little difference in appearance, but provides an ideal combination of accuracy and stopping power.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]SVD scope (permanent)

This shortened sniper rifle with an increase rate of fire is the next step in the evolution of the SVU / Dragunov BP sniper rifle. This weapon used to belong to Max, the legendary guardian of Freedom.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]SVU scope (permanent)

An over/under style hunting shotgun, the TOZ 34 was designed by N. I. Korovyakov and V. P. Ochnev in 1965. Affordable price, high damage output, and it’s ability to unload both rounds instantly makes it a popular weapon among rookies on the outskirts of the Zone. Offers better protection against mutants than a pistol, thanks to its accuracy and stopping power.
An unknown weapon, the firing mechanism of which has not been established. The weapon appears faulty - squeezing the trigger doesn't do anything.

Incorporating several successful handgun design elements, the USP Compact .45 is part of the USP family of handguns designed by H&K. Able to withstand extreme punishment and adverse conditions, it is used by several countries’ police and special forces units.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 11.43x23

A compact, large caliber pistol with short bolt movement and lightweight bolt assembly. Used to belong to a mercenary called Wolfhound. Appears to be a modified USP Compact pistol.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 11.43x23

Developed at the same time as the AS Val assault rifle, the VSS "Vintorez" is intended for sound suppressed sniping. Spetsnaz are issued the VSS for undercover or clandestine operations. To keep it noiseless, it uses subsonic ammunition.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Vintorez scope (permanent)
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer (permanent)

A special variant of the famous VSS sniper rifle. This model has had extensive customization of its internal mechanism which results in increases muzzle velocity and accuracy.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Vintorez scope (permanent)
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer (permanent)

The Mossberg Maverick 88 is a simplified and cheaper version of the pump action Mossberg 500 shotgun. The 18 1/2” barrel allows for 6 rounds in the tube magazine and one in the 3” chamber.A Western smoothbore shotgun that is extremely popular around the world thanks to its amazing reliability and faster reloading speed. Particularly valued for its functionality by the Zone's hunters. This model is camouflaged for hunting in forrests and other nature environments.

The Mossberg Maverick 88 is a simplified and cheaper version of the pump action Mossberg 500 shotgun. The 18 1/2” barrel allows for 6 rounds in the tube magazine and one in the 3” chamber.A Western smoothbore shotgun that is extremely popular around the world thanks to its amazing reliability and faster reloading speed. Particularly valued for its functionality by the Zone's hunters. All of its parts are coated with an anticorrosion compound.

A tailor-made pump-action shotgun which used to belong to Trapper. The hunter's only requirement in respect of his weapon was that it needed to kill predators in one shot. This philosophy was based on the belief that no matter how many people an animal had killed, it was still just an animal, and thus should not suffer.

A key improvement of the AN-94 over the AK-74 is the introduction of the aditional 2-rounds burst mode. Nikonov design delays the force of recoil until the fired round/s have left the barrel. Combining this with a unique 1800 rpm two-shot burst function allows the AN-94 increased body armor piercing capabilities.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scopes
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 5.45x39

A more accurate and reliable rifle than the AKM, the AK-74 is still used by the majority of countries of the former USSR. The AKS-74 is equipped with a side-folding metal shoulder stock and is designed primarily for use with air assault infantry.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Grenadelauncher
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 5.45x39

The AKS-74U was intended as a personal defense weapon for tank, gun, helicopter and other vehicle crews, and for the special operations forces, which required compact but relatively powerful individual automatic weapon.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 5.45x39

A special version of AKS-74U with a different mechanism and barrel. The new mechanism adds a burst mode to the weapon and the modified barrel gives it the same fire range as the AK-74, the modified muzzle brake reduces the recoil even better then on the ordinary AKS-74U which leads to a better handling and accuracy. It has a green or red, LED-illuminated, non-magnified Kobra optical reflex sight.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]AK74u scope (permanent)
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 5.45x39

The M1911 became the standard issue side arm for the U.S. military from 1911 to 1985. An extremely reliable and robust weapon, it’s been adopted for military, police and civilian use around the world and remains a very popular firearm to this day.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 11.43x23

Designed by Magnum Research, US, the Desert Eagle uses a gas-operated mechanism normally found in rifles. This allows the pistol to use far more powerful rounds than traditional semi-automatic pistol designs. The drawback to this weapon is it’s size and weight.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 11.43x23

This futuristic-looking weapon with a bullpup layout is actually a mass produced modular system, comprising a rifle & grenade complex with a computerized fire control system and a 40-mm grenade launcher. Despite its bulky appearance, the weapon is highly ergonomic, easy to use and benefits from good technical characteristics.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scope (permanent)
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 5.56x45
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Grenadelauncher (permanent)

The first pistol developed by the independent Ukraine (one of the former USSR republics), the Fort-12 is a blowback operated, double action pistol. The ergonomics, accuracy and magazine capacity of the Fort 12 are an improvement over the older Makarov PM.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 9x18

The G36K is a carbine version of the G36, a proven successor to the venerable G3. Reliable, robust and adaptable, the G36 family of rifles is used by military, police and special service units in over 30 countries around the world.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]G-36 scope (permanent)
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 5.56x45
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Grenadelauncher m203

The standard individual weapon for the British armed forces, the L85 (in it’s original A1 version) had numerous performance issues. The improved L85A2 is extremely reliable over a range of climates for various operational scenarios.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]l85 scope (permanent)
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Grenadelauncher m203

Based on the AR-15, the LR 300 is an excellent weapon system suitable for military use in close quarters battle. It’s folding skeletal stock makes it ideal for aggressive and rapid building entries requiring a compact yet powerful selective fire weapon.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scopes
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 5.56x45
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Grenadelauncher m203

Issued into service in 1967, the PB (GRAU index 6P9) is a Soviet silenced pistol based on the Makarov PM. It was intended for use by the KGB and army reconnaissance groups. The PB’s integral silencer also reduces the bullet velocity to below subsonic levels.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer (permanent)

This Soviet legacy is the most common pistol in the Zone and is one of the best compact self-defense handguns available. It is small, highly reliable, easy to use and maintain in working order. It also suffers from several drawbacks, including its short range, low firing accuracy and poor stopping power, while also losing out to modern pistols in its class in terms of weight and magazine size.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 9x18

The uniquely designed Armsel Protecta is a rotating cylinder fed 12-gauge shotgun developed for riot control and combat. Antiquated now by the Russian Saiga-12 and the American AA-12, the Protecta was a revolutionary weapon in the 1980’s.A smoothbore combat revolver-type shotgun intended to provide extreme firepower for militarized units. The weapon benefits from a large magazine and a high effective rate of fire, but its bulkiness and considerable weight, combined with a long reload time, are the price to be paid for these advantages. Rare in the Zone and is used primarily to clear closed spaces of mutants.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scopes

The ruggedness, simplicity, low cost, and effectiveness of the RPG-7 has made it the most widely used anti-armor weapon in the world. Currently around 40 countries use the weapon, and it is manufactured in a number of variants by nine countries.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]RPG7 scope (permanent)

Developed for the Swiss Army, the SIG P220 was the basis of what is now a large family of pistols. With no compromise in durability or functionality, the SIG P220 series is of the highest quality, adopted into service by several countries.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer 11.43x23

The SPAS-12 is a dual-mode shotgun, designed for combat and anti-riot measures. It is employed by many special military and police units around the world. With it’s distinctive heat shield and folding stock, the SPAS-12 is an iconic firearm. Notable for its reliability and tactical flexibility. Despite its large weight, complex mechanism and considerable cost it is in demand in the Zone due to its effectiveness against mutants.

The OTs-03 SVU is an improved version of the SVD sniper rifle, developed for the Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs. Designed in a compact bullpup configuration, the SVU utilizes a recoil absorbing muzzle brake and an affixed sound suppressor.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]SVU scope (permanent)

A modified version of the silent VSS Vintorez sniper rifle, this assault rifle was designed as a special forces weapon. The rifle’s primary purpose is effective fire against enemies employing modern personal protection equipment without disclosing the shooter’s location. Thanks to its integrated silencer and 9x39 caliber round with a heavy subsonic bullet, the weapon’s noise and muzzle flash have been reduced to a minimum.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Scopes
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Silencer (permanent)

Super-accurate prototype weapon system developed in secret laboratories located in the Zone. The system operates by accelerating bullets to extreme speeds using electromagnets, which provides incredible stopping power with virtually no recoil.

%c[default]ATTACHMENTS:
%c[255,238,153,26]• %c[default]Gauss scope (permanent)

The 92F is perhaps best known as the standard pistol of the US Military, replacing the legendary M1911. It is a short-recoil operated, locked-breech weapon with an aluminum frame and a hard chromed barrel bore. A popular sidearm adopted by several countries.

Ergonomics being a key focus in it’s design, the Walther P99 is a recoil-operated pistol with a fiberglass polymer frame. Developed for law enforcement and the civilian shooting market, it’s employed by police units in a number of countries.
Batteries that use a capsulated fragment of the Flash artifact as their power source. Manufactured using hi-tech equipment.
These lower-capacity cells use capsulated fragments of the Flash artifact as their power source. Their lower capacity is due to makeshift production conditions and lack of specialized equipment.
A large military combat knife with a rugged rubber handle. Sharp and well maintained.

On a rare occasion a Stalker proves unique talent to his faction during missions of teamwork or lone wolf tasks. Like saving a faction leader from the certain death. Such quality and worth is seen rewarded with an Honorary NR-40. A rare Soviet military knife of high historic and symbolic value. Decorated with an iron emblem of a certain World War 2 parachute division on the wooden handle. Any Stalker holding one of these, be it novice or veteran, is highly respected anywhere in the Zone and especially within his ranks.
A well kept Spetznas military knife ideal for recon class soldiers.
A very endurable hunting knife with a large blade of stainless steel. Ideal for handling larger animals, meat and thick hides.
A customized steel knife with a tip as sharp as a needle. The handle is enforced with rugged fabric for a good grip.

The TRG-42 is not an accurized version of an existing rifle, it was developed from the very beginning as a sniper rifle. It's consistent accuracy and reliability have made it popular for long-range competitions and military sniper operations.
